title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 600.16 - Intimidatory or retaliatory acts
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 600.16 - Intimidatory or retaliatory acts

State Regulations

Any intimidation, threat, coercion or retaliation by or
with the approval of any sponsor against any person for the purpose of
interfering with any right or privilege secured by title VII of the Civil

Rights Act of 1964, as amended; Executive Order 11246, as amended; or because
he or she has made a complaint, testified, assisted or participated in any
manner in any investigation proceeding, or hearing under this Part shall be
considered noncompliance with the equal employment opportunity standards of
this Part. The identity of complainants shall be kept confidential except to
the extent necessary to carry out purposes of this Part, including the conduct
of any investigation, hearing or judicial proceedings arising
therefrom. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12

600.16

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
